pages.title: Intermediate Spells
pages.text: A compendium of all the spells the turtlemancer wand can cast. $(br2)(This wand can also perform the apprentice spells).

pages.title: Bubble Leviosa II
pages.text: It last longer. Also, it heals more.

pages.title: Self Bubble Leviosa II
pages.text: Pressing $(k:turtlemancy.selfbubble) you can get Bubble Leviosa II applied to yourself.

pages.title: Turtlemancer Defense II
pages.text: Use the wand while sneaking to get $(thing)Resistance II$() at the cost of getting $(thing)Slowness I$().

pages.title: Sheep Burst
pages.text: Use the wand against a sheep to make it explode. Yeah. Turtles hate sheeps (but no more than chickens). Why? I don't know. Maybe because they are smooth, cozy and have nearly 360 degree vision. Explode sheeps and get a lot of wool.

pages.title: Squid Burst
pages.text: Use the wand against a squid to make it explode. Yeah. Turtles hate squids (but no more than chickens). Why? I don't know. Maybe because they are ugly underwater monstrous animals. Explode squids and get a lot of ink.

pages.title: Instant Obsidian
pages.text: Use the wand against obsidian to instantly pick it (even crying obsidian). $(br2)Obsidian is nothing for the strengh of a turtle. $(br2)Turtlemancers don't have to spent half a day to pick a single block (even if they are patient enough).

pages.title: Bedrock Breaker
pages.text: Turtlemancers are really powerful. $(br2)Turtlemancers are so powerful that if they use their full power against a bedrock block they can pick up...$(br)a little fragment of it. $(br2)$(o)This spells needs full mana to work.

pages.title: Flint Picker
pages.text: Use the wand against gravel to get flint. Always.

pages.title: Clay Picker
pages.text: Use the wand against clay to get a lot of clay balls.
